Class Budget

java.lang.Object
Budget
public class Budget extends Object
The Budget class represents a financial budget with a specific amount, time period, and optional category. It is used to set spending limits for tracking and comparing against actual expenses.

This class supports both categorized budgets (for specific expense types) and general budgets (for overall spending across all categories).

Version:
0.2
Author:
Magdaluyo, Alaine Carlo R., Cruz, Zachary Andre A.

    Budget(String budgetID, float amount, DateTime start, DateTime end, String category)
    Constructs a complete Budget object with category specification.

  • Constructor Details

    • Budget

      public Budget(String budgetID, float amount, DateTime start, DateTime end, String category)
      Constructs a complete Budget object with category specification. Used for budgets that target specific expense categories.
      Parameters:
      budgetID - the unique identifier for the budget
      amount - the total budget amount
      start - the start date and time of the budget period
      end - the end date and time of the budget period
      category - the expense category this budget applies to

    • Budget

      public Budget(String budgetID, float amount, DateTime start, DateTime end)
      Constructs a general Budget object without category specification. Used for overall spending budgets that apply to all expenses.
      Parameters:
      budgetID - the unique identifier for the budget
      amount - the total budget amount
      start - the start date and time of the budget period
      end - the end date and time of the budget period

  • Method Details

    • getBudgetID

      public String getBudgetID()
      Returns the unique identifier of the budget.
      Returns:
      the budget ID as a String

    • getBudgetAmt

      public float getBudgetAmt()
      Returns the total budget amount.
      Returns:
      the budget amount as a float

    • setBudgetAmt

      public void setBudgetAmt(float amount)
      Sets a new budget amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - the new budget amount to set

    • getBudgetStart

      public DateTime getBudgetStart()
      Returns the start date and time of the budget period.
      Returns:
      the budget start DateTime object

    • getBudgetEnd

      public DateTime getBudgetEnd()
      Returns the end date and time of the budget period.
      Returns:
      the budget end DateTime object

    • getBudgetCategory

      public String getBudgetCategory()
      Returns the category this budget applies to.
      Returns:
      the budget category as a String, or null for general budgets

    • hasCategory

      public boolean hasCategory()
      Checks if this budget has a specific category assigned.
      Returns:
      true if the budget has a non-null, non-empty category, false otherwise
